thread.title: Chicago Police Board Chair: Windy City Needs Federal Help to Turn Tide on Crime
thread.title_full: Chicago Police Board Chair: Windy City Needs Federal Help to Turn Tide on Crime

author: AWR Hawkins
title: Chicago Police Board Chair: Windy City Needs Federal Help to Turn Tide on Crime
text: CHICAGO, IL - APRIL 13: Lori Lightfoot, chair of the Chicago Police Board, addresses community leaders and members of the news media about the findings of the Police Accountability Task Force on April 13, 2016 in Chicago, Illinois. The task force found the Chicago Police Department was plagued by systematic racism and had lost the trust of the community. (Photo by Scott Olson/Getty Images)
